history.content: You'll be able to enroll in upper div CS courses once you're declared. This is usually in June, before Phase 2.

children.subject:
Newly declared majors will all get notified about the same time. Once grades for this semester are in campus systems (which will be a little later than you find out your grade officially) all the major declaration forms are processed pretty quickly.

At this point, the plan is to wait until after new major declarations are processed (after spring grades are reported) and then kick people who are not declared cs/eecs majors off the waitlist at that time.  (We won't be able to wait until appeals have been processed for students who are initially denied.)

This means that it makes sense for students who are taking their last pre-req this semester and are applying now to declare LSCS to waitlist upper division CS courses in phase I but not for anyone else who isn't already a declared cs/eecs major.

So is there any benefit to wait-listing a CS upper div in Phase 1 (upcoming within the next week), if the system allows it ?

When the time comes in June, earlier wait-listed gets off the waitlist sooner ? That would make wait-listing worthwhile. 

Also, does petitioning sooner get you approved sooner, or everybody gets notified about the same time ?

history.content:
The new enrollment system doesn't allow us to block the waitlist in the same way that telebears did.

At this point, the plan is to wait until after new major declarations are processed (after spring grades are reported) and then kick people who are not declared cs/eecs majors off the waitlist at that time.  (We won't be able to wait until appeals have been processed for students who are initially denied.)

This means that it makes sense for students who are taking their last pre-req this semester and are applying now to declare LSCS to waitlist upper division CS courses in phase I but not for anyone else who isn't already a declared cs/eecs major.
I sent in my CS major petition a couple of weeks ago, but I believe they get process once semester grades come out. Will I be able to enroll in upper division CS courses before phase II?
history.subject: Upper div enrollment
